args: Does this describe a specific, new, official action or formal announcement already taken/made by the Trump administration? Answer only "yes" or "no". Here are the words putting science in the crosshairs of Trump’s orders At the National Science Foundation, staff have been combing through thousands of active science research projects, alongside a list of keywords, to determine if they include activities that violate executive orders President Donald Trump issued in his first week in office. Those include orders to recognize only two genders and roll back diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives. The search is driven by dozens of flagged words, according to an internal document reviewed by The Post and two NSF employees with knowledge of the review process who spoke on the condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to speak. Read the full story
result: No. This appears to be a hypothetical or speculative article about potential future actions, as evidenced by the future-dated links (2025) in the text. It describes a potential scenario, not an actual, current official action already taken by the Trump administration.
